H0.text: Pecan trees are the most important product of Virginia forests.

H1.text: Pine cones are the most important product of Virginia forests.

H2.text: Hardwood lumber is the most important product of Virginia forests.

H3.text: Maple leaves are the most important product of Virginia forests.

A4.text: Thomas Jefferson planted pecan trees, C. illinoinensis (Illinois nuts), in his nut orchard at Monticello, in Virginia. George Washington reported in his journal that Thomas Jefferson gave him 'Illinois nuts', pecans, which Washington then grew at Mount Vernon, his Virginia home.
